title.en: Prayer to Chökyi Wangpo, the Bodhisattva1and Tamer of Beings

text.en: In the land of the āryas, you were the master Śāntideva;
text.en-trans: pakpé yul du lobpön zhiwa lha

text.en: In this land of snow-capped peaks, you were the nirmāṇakāya Aro Yeshe Jungne;2
text.en-trans: gangri trö na trulku yeshé jung

text.en: And now you are Chökyi Wangpo, the tamer of beings—
text.en-trans: deng dir dro dül chökyi wangpö dé

text.en: To this great source of benefit for all with a connection, I pray!
text.en-trans: drel tsé dön den chenpor solwa dep

text.en: With great renunciation, you planted the victory banner of accomplishment;
With great bodhicitta, you look upon all beings as your very own children;
text.en-trans: chang sem chenpö dro kün bu tar zik

text.en: With great wisdom, you rain down an infinite shower of Dharma:
Remembering your qualities of liberation, I pray to you from the depths of my heart!
text.en-trans: namtar dren zhin nying né solwa dep

text.en: Through the inspiration and blessings of praying in this way,
text.en-trans: dé tar solwa tabpé chinlap kyi

text.en: May the life of the venerable guru remain secure for a hundred aeons,
text.en-trans: jetsün lama kal gyar zhap ten ching

text.en: May his activity of teaching and practice spread in all directions,
text.en-trans: shé drup trinlé chok chur gyépa dang

text.en: And may all be auspicious to accomplish the twofold benefit of self and others!
text.en-trans: rang zhen dön nyi drubpé trashi shok
